body:
I don't think adding a version to this right now is a good idea. There isn't an obvious place to put it, and it isn't clear what would change over time. I'd like to leave version out for now, and then introduce a version field as a "v2" when it becomes needed and we know *what* is needed. This is a strategy I've seen work well in a lot of places.

I'm not interested in verifying this with json schema at this point. Shield isn't building a generic wrapper around Telemetry events, and we already conform to the schema required by Telemetry. I think that adding some sort of schema validation here will be more error prone than testing the code directly.

> I am also very interested in moving all shield stuff to look like this.

I'm not quite sure what you mean by this, but I'd like to take this a bit slowly. I don't want to get into another case where we send too much data too fast (experiment attribution) or record data that we don't end up using (uptake telemetry). Lets focus on landing enroll and unenroll events, and see what happens from that.
